business.headline: Tata Capital share listing today: Will investors see profit from biggest IPO in 2025?The Rs 15,511.87 crore IPO, which opened for subscription on October 6 and closed on October 8, received bids for 65.33 crore shares against 33.34 crore shares on offer, subscribing 1.96 times overall.

What's in a Will? Understanding the power of your last wordFrom Bollywood dramas where brothers turn against each other to real-life stories of families dragged into courtrooms, most of these disputes begin with one missing document, a will.

Why Indians still prefer buying homes during auspicious monthsBuying a home in India is more than just a financial decision — it is an emotional milestone. For many, choosing the right time to invest is as important as picking the right property, with festivals and auspicious dates playing a big role.

Crypto crash wipes out $19 billion after Trump's 100% China tariffs spark sell-offThe cryptocurrency market suffered a historic crash after US President Donald Trump announced 100% tariffs on China and new export controls on software.

Crisis brews at Bira 91: How a name change shook the popular beer brandFrom beer icon to regulatory nightmare, Bira 91's journey shows how a minor administrative tweak can spiral into financial chaos, employee unrest, and investor anxiety.

LG Electronics vs Tata Capital IPO: What should be your strategy post-listing?Two IPOs, two very different strategies. Tata Capital offers steady long-term growth, while LG Electronics promises quick listing gains. Read on to plan post-listing moves and investment approach carefully.

LG Electronics IPO allotment is finally out. How much listing gain you can expect?Investors who received allotments may be sitting on potential listing gains of Rs 5,000–Rs 6,000 per lot, depending on market sentiment at the time of debut.

Anil Ambani aide and senior Reliance Power executive arrested by EDThe arrest of Ashok Pal, who serves as the executive director at Reliance Power, is related to a suspected fake bank guarantee racket worth Rs 68.2 crore.

Tata History: When Nehru, Jinnah, and Bose allied to save steel companyStarting as a company trading in cotton and opium, the Tata Group has weathered colonial economic warfare, nationalist politics, labor upheaval, and insurgent crises. But it has always emerged stronger through vision, sacrifice, and resilience. In the final episode of our series on the group, we revisit two storms that threatened to sink the Tata brand and image.
Sensex, Nifty end higher as financial stocks rally; Cipla, SBI among top gainersSensex ends 328 points higher, Nifty above 25,250; Cipla, SBI lead gains

Convenience or debt trap? The hidden cost of BPNL, easy credit and festive offersEvery festive season, easy credit makes everything—from gadgets to holidays—look affordable. But behind the glitter of BNPL schemes and "no-cost EMIs" lies a growing debt trap that's quietly eroding financial freedom.

Tata Trusts trustee Vijay Singh calls internal rift unprecedented: ReportVijay Singh, who serves as a trustee and vice-chairman of Tata Trusts, said that the act of voting on internal matters went against the long-standing principles followed during Ratan Tata's leadership.

WeWork India slips 5% in debut trade amid valuation, governance concernsCorporate governance firm InGovern warned investors of WeWork India's fragile financials, negative cash flow, high lease liabilities, and the absence of fresh capital infusion.

Buy, borrow, die: The wealth cheat code the rich don't share, explains CAEver wondered how wealthy families keep growing their wealth while others struggle with taxes and inflation? CA reveals a simple three-step strategy: Buy, Borrow, Die. Have a look.

LG Electronics IPO GMP touches Rs 400: Here's how to check allotment statusLG IPO: The GMP is an indicator of market sentiment, showing the expected difference between the IPO price and the likely listing price. With the upper price band set at Rs 1,140, a GMP of Rs 400 suggests the shares could debut at around Rs 1,540, implying potential listing gains of roughly 35%.
TCS reports 20,000 layoffs, employees' advocacy group questions transparencyThe IT giant's employee strength fell from 6,13,069 on June 30 to 5,93,314, according to Q2FY26 data posted on its website.

Stopping PF contributions? What it means for your retirement savingsPausing your PF contributions may seem harmless, but it can slow down your retirement savings. Even if your money stays safe, missing deposits could mean losing valuable interest and tax benefits over time.

What's brewing at Bira 91? Over 250 employees seek removal of founder, says reportEmployees cited "corporate governance failure, lack of transparency, delays in salaries and dues," as well as cases filed by creditors indicating deteriorating financials and pending vendor payments.

Tata Capital IPO vs LG IPO GMP: Which one is likely to give better returns? Tata Capital's IPO, priced between Rs 310–Rs 326, shows modest grey market premiums of Rs 6–Rs 7, indicating limited listing gains. LG Electronics India's IPO, at Rs 1,140, boasts Rs 380 GMP, suggesting strong upside.

Bitcoin slips again. 3 reasons why the crypto market is downBitcoin's price has slipped again this week, signalling renewed volatility in the digital asset space. From rising US inflation worries to ETF outflows, here's what's dragging crypto prices lower.

entertainment.headline: Emotional Sarah Paulson breaks down outside Diane Keaton's home after her death Diane Keaton's close friend and actor Sarah Paulson was seen emotional outside her home, paying tribute to the beloved star amidst requests for family privacy.

Allu Arjun's wife Sneha shares epic birthday dinner pics that scream luxury Sneha Reddy posted intimate birthday dinner photos with Allu Arjun. The couple's monochrome looks and candid moments attract attention.

Priyanka Chopra falls for Delhi's magic ahead of SSMB 29 shoot in city Priyanka Chopra has returned to Delhi, sharing glimpses of her busy schedule as she shoots for the highly anticipated film 'SSMB 29' with SS Rajamouli and Mahesh Babu.

All stars, no spark: Kajol, Twinkle's Two Much is too much noise Kajol and Twinkle Khanna's celebrity chat show 'Two Much' promised laughs, gasps, and celebrity revelations. Three episodes in, here's why we think the show is just too much noise and no real substance.

Diane Keaton's bond with Justin Bieber becomes fans' favourite memory Diane Keaton, the legendary actor known for iconic roles, is also known for her heartwarming friendship with pop star Justin Bieber. Their unique bond, highlighted by her role in Bieber's music video 'Ghost', has touched fans worldwide.

Wonder Man trailer: Yahya Abdul-Mateen II takes centre stage in Marvel's satire Marvel Studios has unveiled the trailer for 'Wonder Man', a new series starring Yahya Abdul-Mateen II that blends superhero themes with sharp Hollywood satire. The show explores identity and fame through the journey of a struggling actor turned reluctant hero, offering a fresh take distinct from the original comics.

Matlock Season 2: When and where to stream Kathy Bates' courtroom comeback 'Matlock' has made a gripping return to CBS with its second season. The show, headlined by Kathy Bates, aired on CBS on October 12.

Bigg Boss 19 Weekend Ka Vaar: Zeishan Quadri evicted from Salman Khan's show After receiving the least number of votes, 'Gangs of Wasseypur' writer Zeishan Quadri has been evicted from 'Bigg Boss 19'. Actor Salman Khan announced his exit on 'Weekend Ka Vaar.'

Varun exits No Entry 2 after Diljit, search for new leads underway: Report Actor Varun Dhawan has reportedly left 'No Entry 2' after Punjabi singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh's departure. While Arjun Kapoor is still a part of the cast, the makers are on the hunt for new lead actors.

Akshay doesn't work for more than 8 hours: Abhishek's old clip goes viral A viral clip shows actor Abhishek Bachchan sharing his colleague Akshay Kumar's strict 8-hour workday policy. The clip is from the time the actors appeared on the Kapil Sharma show to promote their 'Housefull 3.'

Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man 2 set for 2026 release. What to expect The second season of 'Your Friendly Neighbourhood Spider-Man' is likely to arrive on Disney+ in 2026. The trailer, shown at New York Comic Con, offered fans a first look at Venom and the return of several characters.

SRK teases KJo on Ozempic, Karan claps back with Wankhede reference Actor Shah Rukh Khan joked about filmmaker Karan Johar's weight loss at the 70th Filmfare Awards on Saturday. Karan responded with a witty Wankhede remark, referencing a controversy.

Kajol wins Internet with 'most epic throwback ever' ft SRK Actor Kajol shared a then-and-now picture with her 'Dilwale Dulhaniya Le Jayenge' co-star Shah Rukh Khan on Sunday. She celebrated their journey by posting a heartfelt message after receiving her seventh Filmfare award.

AI-reimagined Mahabharat to premiere on OTT: When and where to watch India's epic Mahabharat is returning in an AI-reimagined version, premiering on WAVES OTT on October 25 and on Doordarshan from November 2. The series uses advanced AI to recreate the story's characters, battlefields, and moral dilemmas with cinematic scale.

From reels to reality: How Guru Randhawa is turning Instagram into talent hunt Instagram Reels are replacing auditions for singer Guru Randhawa's latest projects. Influencer Ahsii, who recently played lead in Pan India, talked to us about how her viral clip landed her on a music video set.

Katy Perry, Justin Trudeau seen kissing on yacht amid dating rumours Popstar Katy Perry and former Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau were seen kissing and cuddling on a yacht in California. These new viral pictures, which seemingly confirmed their dating rumours, came months after their first public outing in Montreal.

Shah Rukh Khan saves Nitanshi Goel as she trips on stage, video goes viral Nitanshi Goel won the Best Debut Female award at Filmfare 2025 for 'Laapataa Ladies', with Shah Rukh Khan and Karan Johar hosting the ceremony. A heartwarming moment went viral when Nitanshi tripped on stage and Shah Rukh quickly came to her rescue.

Bigg Boss Tamil 9: Vijay Sethupathi rips apart Kamrudin, VJ Parvathy  Bigg Boss Tamil 9 host Vijay Sethupathi called out contestants for their gameplay and failure to manage the week's tasks, especially targeting Kamrudin and VJ Parvathy. His tough comments left Aurora and Parvathy upset, with Sethupathi advising them to maintain dignity while highlighting areas for improvement.

Diane Keaton dies at 79, Leonardo, Jane Fonda and other Hollywood celebs pay tribute Hollywood legend Diane Keaton, famous for 'Annie Hall' and 'The Godfather', passed away at 79. Celebrities like Leonardo DiCaprio, Jane Fonda, and Michael Douglas paid heartfelt tributes, remembering her iconic performances and unique personality.

general news.headline: Gaza war over: Trump heads to Israel as stage set for hostage-prisoner swap Live UpdatesDonald Trump said some hostages might be released earlier than expected and announced that a "Board of Peace" would be set up soon to oversee Gaza's reconstruction, describing the enclave as a "demolition site."

These 3 top Delhi malls may shut down in coming daysThree of South Delhi's most prominent malls, DLF Promenade, DLF Emporio, and Ambience Mall in Vasant Kunj, are on the brink of closure due to a severe water crisis.

I'm good at solving wars: Denied Nobel, Trump now eyes Afghan-Pak conflictDonald Trump dismissed claims he sought a Nobel Prize, and again claimed credit for averting war between India and Pakistan through tariffs. He set off for Israel and Egypt to celebrate the US-brokered ceasefire and hostage deal.

Israeli man who saw his girlfriend killed by Hamas sets himself on fire, diesAt least 378 people, including 344 civilians were on October 7, 2023, when Hamas-led Palestinian militants crossed from Gaza into Israel and attacked the Nova open-air music festival and nearby communities. This unprecedented attack prompted Israel to wage its ongoing war against Hamas in Gaza.
She plans, she books, she travelsA new report by Booking.com reveals that women are increasingly taking the lead in travel planning across Indian households.

Priyanka Gandhi seeks probe after Kerala techie's suicide due to 'RSS sexual abuse'Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has demanded a full investigation after Kerala IT professional Anandu Aji was found dead, leaving a final social media post alleging repeated sexual abuse by multiple RSS members.

Deliberately distorted: Mamata Banerjee on shocking Durgapur gang-rape remarkWest Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, under fire over her shocking remark on the Durgapur gang-rape, claimed her statement was deliberately distorted and an attempt to politically malign her.

Union Minister Suresh Gopi offers to resign, cites drop in incomeUnion Minister Suresh Gopi expressed his wish to resign from his post, citing a decline in income and recommending BJP leader C Sadanandan Master as his replacement.

Katy Perry, Justin Trudeau seen kissing on yacht amid dating rumoursPopstar Katy Perry and former Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau were seen kissing and cuddling on a yacht in California. These new viral pictures, which seemingly confirmed their dating rumours, came months after their first public outing in Montreal.

How Alyssa Healy pulled off an all-time classic for AustraliaAlyssa Healy unfurled a sensational 142, a knock marked by both genius and grit, as she capitalised on India's inexperienced bowling attack to help Australia pull off an all-time classic at a packed Vizag Stadium.

Video: Bartender's fire stunt goes wrong at Dehradun nightclub, 2 severely burntA fire-breathing stunt at a Dehradun nightclub went wrong on Saturday night, injuring two bartenders and triggering panic among hundreds of guests.

Live: All eyes on Gaza as Israeli hostages set to be released in few hoursThe Gaza peace summit, co-chaired by US President Donald Trump and Egyptian President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi, is underway today at an Egyptian Red Sea resort. The meeting aims to consolidate the recently brokered ceasefire between Israel and Hamas and lay the groundwork for a lasting resolution to the conflict.

Leaders from over 20 nations, along with the UN Secretary-General, are attending the summit, which seeks to end the war in Gaza, strengthen regional stability, and rally global support for the next phases of the U.S.-backed peace plan.

The summit will also feature the formal signing of the ceasefire agreement reached after weeks of intense, indirect negotiations -- though neither Israel nor Hamas, the main parties to the conflict, will be present for the ceremony.

Stay tuned to India Today for the latest updates as this pivotal day for the Middle East unfolds.

All stars, no spark: Kajol, Twinkle's Two Much is too much noiseKajol and Twinkle Khanna's celebrity chat show 'Two Much' promised laughs, gasps, and celebrity revelations. Three episodes in, here's why we think the show is just too much noise and no real substance.

NDA finalises Bihar seat-sharing deal, BJP and JDU to contest 101 seats eachThe BJP and the JD(U) will fight on 101 seats each in Bihar, followed by 29 for Chirag Paswan's LJP (R) and six each for the Rashtriya Lok Morcha (RLM) and the Hindustani Awam Morcha (HAM), Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said as he unveiled the NDA's seat-sharing formula.

Xi had a bad moment: Trump says US wants to help China amid tariff standoffDonald Trump signals calm amid escalating US-China trade dispute, saying America wants to help China, not hurt it, as both nations trade fresh tariff threats.

Mount Everest visible from Bihar: Astronaut captures it from spaceThis awe-inspiring perspective comes just as a separate video showing Mount Everest visible from Bihar captured attention across social media, igniting fresh fascination with the world's tallest peak.

iPhones, clothes, perfumes: Flipkart goods worth Rs 1.21 crore stolen from truckA truck carrying Flipkart consignments worth over Rs 1.21 crore was robbed, with stolen items including iPhones, clothes, and perfumes. Punjab Police have booked the driver and his helper for the theft.

Education privilege of a few, free thinking attacked in India: Rahul Gandhi in PeruSpeaking during an interaction, Rahul Gandhi highlighted challenges facing education, social inclusivity, and independent thinking in India.

Is artificial intelligence fading human memory?Voice assistants remind us of birthdays; apps keep medical records organised. The conveniences of artificial intelligence make life easier but also raise a deeper concern

The show explores identity and fame through the journey of a struggling actor turned reluctant hero, offering a fresh take distinct from the original comics.

After batting collapse vs AUS, India coach says team has settled, flexible orderAfter the loss to Australia, India coach Amol Muzumdar said that his side's batting order is settled but can be flexible if needed. India failed to capitalise on their momentum and lost to the Aussies in the end.

Not intentional snub: Taliban minister at press meet redo with women journalistsAfter facing sharp criticism for excluding women journalists from a press meet in New Delhi on Friday, visiting Afghan Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi on Sunday called another, "inclusive" press conference and offered a clarification for the earlier omission.

Video: 2 Vadodara men try to attack friend with swords, made to do sit-ups by copsTwo men in Vadodara attacked their friend with swords and a dagger over an old rivalry, prompting police action after the video went viral. The accused were arrested, made to do sit-ups as punishment, and booked under multiple IPC sections.

Young KBC contestant's behaviour divides Internet, sparks debate on parentingYoung Ishit Bhatt's conduct on KBC 17 sparked strong reactions online. Viewers criticised his overconfidence and questioned parental guidance, while some users called for restraint and balanced judgement.

Emotional Sarah Paulson breaks down outside Diane Keaton's home after her deathDiane Keaton's close friend and actor Sarah Paulson was seen emotional outside her home, paying tribute to the beloved star amidst requests for family privacy.

sports.headline: IND vs AUS: How India blunted out even before Australia clash Women's World Cup, IND vs AUS: India were tactically off the mark and poorly planned, resulting in a three-wicket loss to Australia. With plenty to reflect on, they now have thinking to do ahead of their clash against England on October 19 in Indore.

Day 4: Kuldeep, Jadeja eye quick end to West Indies resistance India (IND) vs West Indies (WI), 2nd Test Day 4 Live Score Updates: Kuldeep Yadav and Ravindra Jadeja will be in focus as India eye a quick end to this Test match. John Campbell and Shai Hope put up an admirable resistance in the final session of Day 3, one that India would like to end.

How Alyssa Healy pulled off an all-time classic for Australia Alyssa Healy unfurled a sensational 142, a knock marked by both genius and grit, as she capitalised on India's inexperienced bowling attack to help Australia pull off an all-time classic at a packed Vizag Stadium.

Alyssa Healy on breaking free from rough patch: I was frustrated, out of rhythm Women's World Cup: Alyssa Healy roared back to form with a stunning 142 off 107 balls, guiding Australia to a thrilling three-wicket win over India in the Women's World Cup clash at Visakhapatnam.

After batting collapse vs AUS, India coach says team has settled, flexible order After the loss to Australia, India coach Amol Muzumdar said that his side's batting order is settled but can be flexible if needed. India failed to capitalise on their momentum and lost to the Aussies in the end.

Nahida Akter backs Nigar Sultana amid batting woes ahead of South Africa clash Bangladesh spinner Nahida Akter has defended captain Nigar Sultana amid poor batting form in the Women's World Cup 2025. The team remains hopeful of a strong comeback in their next match against South Africa.

India head coach eyes bowling depth, addresses dot ball concerns post AUS loss India women's cricket team head coach Amol Muzumdar has said that the team will look to add bowling depth heading ahead in the tournament after their 3-wicket defeat against Australia in the Women's World Cup 2025.

Batting woes, 6th bowler issue: Harmanpreet Kaur says India has much to fix India captain Harmanpreet Kaur said that the late batting order collapse let the team down in their agonising loss to Australia in Vizag on Sunday, October 12. Australia secured a record win after chasing down 331 in 49 overs.

How Alyssa Healy negated Sree Charani threat to down India Women's World Cup, IND vs AUS: Alyssa Healy scored a match-winning 142 to lead Australia to a record run-chase of 331 against India, carefully targeting bowlers around key threat Sree Charani.

Alyssa Healy storm hits Vizag, sinks India in record chase Captain Alyssa Healy smashed a jaw-dropping 142 as Australia pulled off the highest-ever chase in women's ODI history, hunting down 331 against hosts India in front of a roaring crowd at the ACA-VDCA Stadium on a Super Sunday to remember.

Premier League: Florian Wirtz's slow Liverpool start defended by Nagelsmann Germany coach Julian Nagelsmann called for patience with Liverpool's Florian Wirtz as he struggles to adapt to the Premier League. The German midfielder is yet to record a goal or assist in his first seven league matches after arriving from Bayer Leverkusen for a club-record fee.

South Africa ready for tough spin challenge against Bangladesh: Tumi SekhukhuneSouth Africa seamer Temi Sekhukhune has said that they're wary of the Bangladesh spin challenge ahead of their clash in the Women's World Cup 2025 in Visakhapatnam.

Not dwelling too much on win over India, every game important for us: SekhukhuneSouth Africa seamer Tumi Sekhukhune said that they will not dwell too much on their thrilling victory against India and treat every game equally ahead of their fixture against Bangladesh in Visakhapatnam.

AIFF adopts new constitution, leaves out two clauses for SC clarification: ReportThe All India Football Federation has adopted the Supreme Court-approved constitution, leaving two contentious clauses pending. This move comes amid a FIFA deadline and ahead of the upcoming AIFF elections, creating uncertainty around governance reforms.

Kuldeep Yadav's mystery spinner element makes him dangerous: Ryan ten DoeschateIndia assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate has said that the mystery spinner element makes Kuldeep Yadav a dangerous bowler after his fine performance in the Delhi Test. Kuldeep picked up five wickets against West Indies on Sunday, October 12.

IND vs WI: Did India plan to bat again in Delhi Test? Ten Doeschate respondsIndia's assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate said that the hosts thought about batting again before enforcing the follow-on on West Indies during the Delhi Test. India bowled out West Indies for 248 in the first innings but struggled to get wickets in the second one.

The clip of the incident has been going viral on social media.

Jayden Seales fined for 'dangerous' throw at Yashasvi Jaiswal in DelhiWest Indies pacer Jayden Seales has been sanctioned with a 25% match fee deduction and awarded a demerit point by the ICC after his throw struck India's Yashasvi Jaiswal on the pad in the second Test in Delhi.

Grandpa and Grandma would be proud: Vacherot in tears after beating cousin RinderknechValentin Vacherot claimed his maiden ATP Tour title at the 2025 Shanghai Masters, defeating cousin Arthur Rinderknech. His historic win as the lowest-ranked Masters 1000 champion highlights a remarkable journey filled with emotion and resilience.

Ramiz Raja's bizarre comment on Babar Azam in Lahore Test goes viralPAK vs SA, 1st Test: Ramiz Raja was heard making a bizarre comment when Babar Azam sent one LBW decision upstairs on Day 1 of the opening Test against South Africa at Gaddafi Stadium.

Neeru Pathak's uphill sprint: On spikes, sacrifice, and salvationNeeru Pathak chases her dreams on the track while carrying the weight of her family's hopes — a teenage sprinter running against odds, time, and uncertainty.

IND vs AUS: Mithali Raj stand, Ravi Kalpana gate unveiled at Vizag stadiumMithali Raj and Ravi Kalpana were honoured by the Andhra Cricket Association (ACA) as the they got a stand and a gate named after them respectively. Mithali had a storied career for India in women's international cricket.

Abhishek Sharma won't last six balls: Pakistan pacer Ihsanullah makes bold claimPakistan pacer Ihsanullah believes that Abhishek Sharma would not last an over from him and would get him dismissed in just three balls. This comes after India's recent win over Pakistan in the Asia Cup 2025 tournament.

IND vs WI: West Indies batters show up too little too late as India remain in commandIND vs WI 2nd Test Day 3: The West Indies put up a rare fightback in the second innings. But it might prove to be futile considering the deficit left to go as India holds control in the Test.

Out of my comfort zone: Former NZ coach Gary Stead ready for Andhra challengeGary Stead said that the job as the new Andhra coach is out of his comfort zone but is eager for the new challenge. Stead took over as the new Andhra red-ball coach after his tenure with New Zealand came to an end.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
